remarks: In the paper "On Variable Functors of Propositional Arguments", Lukasiewicz introduced a system that can handle variable connectives. This was done by introducing a variable, marked with a lowercase delta, which takes a wff as input.  In the system, "delta ` ph ` " means that "something is true of ` ph ` ."  "delta ` ph ` " can be substituted with ` -. ph ` , ` ps /\ ph ` , ` A. x ph ` , etc. Later on, Meredith discovered a single axiom, in the form of ` ( ` delta delta ` F. -> ` delta ` ph ` ` ) ` .  This represents the shortest theorem in the extended propositional calculus that cannot be derived as an instance of a theorem in propositional calculus. A symmetry with ` -. ` .  (Contributed by Anthony Hart, 4-Sep-2011.)
